intro: Chaptalia herzogiana, commonly known as the Herzog's chaptalia, is a flowering plant native to the Andes region of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, often in rocky or alpine habitats. Its foliage consists of narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of white hairs. The flowers are small and yellow, arranged in clusters, and bloom during the warmer months of the year.
